abstract: Alastair Macaulay reviews premiere of solo dance piece World Fair, performed and choreographed by Rachid Ouramdane at New York Live Arts as part of Crossing the Line festival.
snippet: The choreographer Rachid Ouramdane is known for pieces about the psychological effects torture and genocide, but his latest work, “World Fair,” reveals a different direction.
lead_paragraph: The choreographer Rachid Ouramdane is known for pieces about the psychological effects torture and genocide, but his latest work, “World Fair,” reveals a different direction.

headline.main: A Question of Identity and Its Mark on the Body
headline.print_headline: A Question of Identity and Its Mark on the Body
headline.seo: Rachid Ouramdane’s ‘World Fair’ at New York Live Arts — Review
